text: Recluse vase by Johnny Rolf, 1970 Johanna Jacoba (Johnny) Rolf (born The Hague 30 September 1936) is a Dutch ceramist, drawing artist and sculptor.Biographical data at the Netherlands Institute for Art History. == LIfe and work == Rolf was educated into the pottery profession by Jan de Rooden, with whom she started a studio in 1958 and married.Jan de Rooden (1931-), Items door kunstenaar/bedrijf - Literatuur over kunstenaar/bedrijf at artentique.nl. Accessed 16.05.2015. One of her students was the Dutch ceramist Mariet Schmidt, born in Schiedam in 1935.Schmidt, Mariet | Capriolus Collectable Ceramics In 1962 Rolf took part of an exhibition of six young ceramists from Amsterdam in Museum Boijmans Van Beuningen, together with Hans de Jong, Sonja Landweer, Johan van Loon, Jan de Rooden and Jan van der Vaart, which signified the rebirth of artisan ceramics in the Netherlands.Mienke Simon Thomas (2008). Goed in vorm: honderd jaar ontwerpen in Nederland. p. 188 In 1966 he was visiting designer at the Gustavsberg porcelain factory in Zweden. In 1964 he and Jan de Rooden were awarded the "Contour Prijs" by De Koninklijke Porceleyne Fles in Delft. == Works in public collections == * Gemeentemuseum Den Haag"A Life Story in Ceramics 1957-2006" at www.gemeentemuseum.nl, 10.10.2012 * Princessehof Ceramics MuseumJohnny Rolf in Princessehof Ceramics Museum collection, 2015. * Stedelijk Museum AmsterdamCollectie Wim Crouwel: Johnny Rolf, recent werk uit srie ovens, 1980, at stedelijk.nl/en/artwork/52912.
